text: Wilfred Edwards (23 October 1889 - 15 July 1950) was a British swimmer. He competed in the men's 100 metre freestyle event at the 1908 Summer Olympics. ==Personal life== Edwards served in the Royal Army Veterinary Corps during the First World War and was mentioned in dispatches. ==References== Category:1889 births Category:1950 deaths Category:British male swimmers Category:Olympic swimmers of Great Britain Category:Swimmers at the 1908 Summer Olympics Category:Sportspeople from Chester Category:Royal Army Veterinary Corps soldiers Category:Male freestyle swimmers
title: Wilfred Edwards (swimmer)
